message.entry: File name must be a non-empty string or character vector.
Invalid value ''{1}'' specified for ''{0}''.
Input must be a cell array with {0,number,integer} elements.
Unable to write to file: {0}\n{1}
Variable "{0}" must have type ''{1}''
Second argument must have at least one variable.

Variable "{0}" has attributes that are unsupported for writing to a Parquet file. Supported variable types include:

 numeric, logical, categorical, datetime, duration, string, cellstr, char, cell, table, timetable

Char variables can be matrices. Other non-tabular variables must be column vectors. Doubles and logicals must be non-sparse. All numeric variables must be real.
Char variables must be char matrices to be written to a Parquet file.
Cell variables must be cell arrays of character vectors to be written to a Parquet file.
Nested table variables must contain at least one variable.
Dictionary encoding is not supported for logical variable "{0}".\nSet the value of "VariableEncoding" to ''auto'' or ''plain'' encoding for this variable.
''{0}'' must have {1,number,integer} elements.
Unable to find directory: {0}
"RowGroupHeights" specified as a scalar cannot be zero when the input table has a positive height: {0} row(s).\n\nSpecify a positive scalar value for "RowGroupHeights".
"RowGroupHeights" input: {1} sums up to the value: {2}. "RowGroupHeights" specified as a vector must sum up to the height of the input table: {0} row(s).
''{0}'' is a LIST of DICTIONARY arrays written to multiple row groups. LIST of DICTIONARY arrays must be read using the parquetread RowGroups name-value argument.
''{0}'' contains a LIST of DICTIONARY arrays written to multiple row groups. LIST of DICTIONARY arrays must be read using the parquetread RowGroups name-value argument.
Unable to write Parquet file "{0}". Unrecognized URL scheme.
The offsets and paths vectors must be non-empty.
The offsets vector must be in ascending order.
The last value in the offsets vector must be equal to the size of the paths vector.
The number of top-level variables encoded in ColumnLeafsPath is {0,number,integer}. Expected the number of top-level variables to be {1,number,integer}.
